result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Samolyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $100/month commencing April 15, 2016 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel P Samolyk

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Jeremy J Guza.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached.  Def enters guilty plea. Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court imposes fine of $579 to be paid at rate of $100/mo comm 4-15-16 or judgment shall enter.    Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis; Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Jeremy J Guza.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Pretrial held, offer received; Last adjournment, if no resolution, Court will set for trial;  Plea hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jeremy J Guza.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Offer rec'd - resolution expected.  Counsel req adj.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with LAS or her daughter MMS or JMRW

Def in person & by Atty Jeremy J Guza.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $150 cash bond, previously posted.  Discovery rec'd; Counsel req adj.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
